definition[0]: a situation or a way of doing something that is new and exciting and meant to improve people’s lives
example[0]: the brave new world of digital television
definition[1]: an advanced society of the future, in which many people seem to have easy and pleasant lives but in fact nobody has any freedom. This type of society is described in the novel Brave New World by Aldous Huxley. The phrase was first used in Shakespeare’s play The Tempest.
